entries.title: Argentina president seeks impeachment of Supreme Court chief
entries.description: Moves comes after Alberto Fernandez clashed with the judiciary over ruling allocating more funds to Buenos Aires.

entries.title: Thousands attend funeral of three Kurds killed in Paris shooting
entries.description: A xenophobic gunman is suspected of killing two men and one woman at a Kurdish cultural centre last month.

entries.title: Apple’s market value drops below $2 trillion
entries.description: The sharp fall is on the back of concerns that high inflation and a slowing global economy will hurt demand.

entries.title: Former crypto titan Sam Bankman-Fried pleads not guilty to fraud
entries.description: The 30-year-old FTX founder, formerly worth an estimated $26bn, could face a sentence of up to 115 years in US prison.

entries.title: Thousands of Saudi fans cheer as Ronaldo unveiled at Al Nassr
entries.description: Cristiano Ronaldo has been officially presented to fans at his new Saudi Arabian club, where he received a warm welcome.

entries.title: Tesla shares plunge 13 percent on growth concerns
entries.description: Once worth more than $1 trillion, Tesla lost more than 65 percent in 2022 and $60bn on Tuesday alone.

entries.title: ELN rebel group denies ceasefire with Colombian government
entries.description: President Petro has asserted that five armed groups, including the ELN, committed to six months of peace through June.

entries.title: As winter chill sets in, Delhi’s homeless struggle to stay warm
entries.description: Tens of thousands of the unhoused in India’s capital struggle to find shelter as temperatures fall.

entries.title: What’s next for the EU after Croatia joins the Eurozone?
entries.description: Croatia has adopted the euro and joined the European Union's Schengen zone.

entries.title: US House fails to elect new speaker in first round of voting
entries.description: Kevin McCarthy falls short of majority in now Republican-controlled chamber amid opposition from far-right legislators.

entries.title: Pakistan to close malls, markets early due to economic crisis
entries.description: Pakistan's defence minister says shops to shut down by 8:30pm and restaurants by 10pm under new energy-saving plan.

entries.title: Iran vows to avenge Qassem Soleimani’s killing three years ago
entries.description: Soleimani, the commander of the Quds Force, was killed in a US drone strike in Baghdad on January 3, 2020.

entries.title: Bulgaria signs long-term agreement to use Turkish gas terminals
entries.description: Bulgaria will have access to Turkey's LNG terminals and transit network to secure alternatives to Russian gas.

entries.title: As fighting continues, a Mariupol survivor rebuilds life in Kyiv
entries.description: Ulvi Zulfili fled one war as a child and found a new home in Ukraine, only to have to flee again - and barely survive.

entries.title: What we know about Ukraine’s attack in Makiivka
entries.description: On New Year's Day, Ukrainian forces targeted barracks in one of the deadliest attacks on Russia since the war began.

entries.title: Brazil’s Lula pays respects to Pele, 150,000 attend stadium wake
entries.description: Outpouring tributes continue for iconic Brazilian footballer, who will be laid to rest near his Santos Football Club.

entries.title: Iran indicts two French nationals for spying
entries.description: Iranian authorities accuse the unnamed French citizens of spying and colluding against national security.

entries.title: Can a Republican win the US presidency in 2024?
entries.description: Donald Trump is the biggest obstacle on the Republican Party's path to the White House.

entries.title: Tanzania’s President Hassan lifts 6-yr ban on opposition rallies
entries.description: Her predecessor John Magafuli banned political rallies by opposition groups in the country in 2016.

entries.title: Rising prices behind bars hammer imprisoned people in the US
entries.description: Inflation in US economy has translated to added costs for imprisoned individuals and the families who support them.

entries.title: Nigeria to pay extra $4bn if loan-bond swap is denied: Buhari
entries.description: Some lawmakers had questioned the plan to convert $53bn in central bank overdrafts into 40-year bonds.

entries.title: Afghanistan used to launch attacks on Pakistan: Defence minister
entries.description: Pakistan says no country will be allowed to shelter armed groups staging attacks against it as Kabul reject the charges.

entries.title: UK rail workers resume strike action as negotiations stall again
entries.description: More sectors to join industrial action as workers demand a living wage that allows them to cope with surging inflation.

entries.title: Israel’s Ben-Gvir enters Al-Aqsa: Why was it seen as provocative?
entries.description: The far-right Israeli national security minister was warned that his move would spark violence - by Israel's former PM.

entries.title: Burkina Faso officials say 28 people found shot dead
entries.description: An investigation has been launched into the deaths of 28 people whose bodies were discovered on December 30-31.

entries.title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian teenager in Bethlehem
entries.description: Adam Ayyad, 15, was killed during an Israeli army raid on the Dheisheh refugee camp in Bethlehem.

entries.title: After 44 years, London’s first Arabic bookshop closes down
entries.description: Al-Saqi Books represented a treasure trove of literary works for Arab expatriates in London and visitors alike.

entries.title: Making Her Future: A multitalented woman in Gabon
entries.description: A modern, cross-national young African woman runs a portfolio of careers in Gabon and looks towards her future.

entries.title: China blasts ‘unacceptable’ COVID curbs on travellers
entries.description: The US, Canada, Japan and France are among more than a dozen countries that have put curbs on travellers from China.

entries.title: Two children killed in Kashmir blast day after four gunned down
entries.description: Five-year-old boy and 12-year-old girl die in the blast a day after four people were gunned down by suspected rebels.

entries.title: Russian hypocrisy and the death of a Zambian student in Ukraine
entries.description: Lemekhani Nyirenda's life and death expose the fallacy of Russian anti-imperialist rhetoric on Africa.

entries.title: Medine, The Heritage: Preserving Mali’s history
entries.description: A father-son duo attend to the old colonial Fort of Medine in Mali, preserving history and passing on a legacy.

entries.title: EU considers alignment on China passengers as COVID cases surge
entries.description: EU to meet to determine if a coordinated approach on entry to the region is necessary for visitors from China.

entries.title: NFL: Damar Hamlin in ‘critical condition’ after collapse on field
entries.description: The Buffalo Bills said Hamlin, who collapsed on the field after making a tackle, suffered a cardiac arrest.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 314
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 314th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Bahamas regulator rejects FTX’s claims about seized assets’ value
entries.description: Securities Commission of the Bahamas says debtors of the bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange had 'incomplete information.'

entries.title: In provocation, Israel far-right minister enters Al-Aqsa compound
entries.description: Ben-Gvir has entered the Al Aqsa Mosque compound, in a move Palestinians call 'unprecedented provocation'.

entries.title: Singapore’s economy beats forecasts with 3.8% growth in 2022
entries.description: City-state's growth slowed sharply in fourth quarter, clouding outlook for 2023.

entries.title: Russia plans drone air campaign to “exhaust” Ukraine: Zelenskyy
entries.description: More than 80 drones launched by Russia shot down by Ukrainian forces in first two days of 2023, Ukraine president says.

entries.title: South Korea unveils tax breaks for domestic investments in chips
entries.description: Finance ministry says measures will save firms more than $2.85bn in tax payments for 2024.

entries.title: Biden denies US in talks on nuclear exercises with South Korea
entries.description: S Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol said Seoul and Washington were in talks on exercises involving US nuclear assets.

entries.title: Australia’s COVID tests for China went against health advice
entries.description: Australia's chief medical officer advised there was not 'sufficient public health rationale' for new travel rules.

entries.title: Ronaldo arrives in Saudi Arabia ahead of unveiling by Al Nassr
entries.description: Cristiano Ronaldo will be presented at the club's Mrsool Park stadium in Riyadh at 7pm (16:00 GMT) on Tuesday.

entries.title: Mexico’s Supreme Court elects first female president
entries.description: The court selected Norma Pina in a 6-to-5 vote on Monday, elevating a figure who has clashed with Mexico's president.
